messages: 375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:06): I added the !doctype html (html 5 doctype) to my website, and it made a little white space at the bottom of the page, any ideas why? http://www.modernwebpro.com/dan/about/index.html
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:08): 375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae because that background image isn't actually set as a background in css

0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:10): <div id="backgroundImage" style="visibility: visible;"><img src="background.jpg" style="width: 100%; height: auto; top: 0px; margin-top: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left:0px;" alt="DA Music Studios" /></div>
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:25): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 so there is no way to fix it?
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:25): ?g css backgrounds
38e5971429bb0f30aa410ac1ae0bb9a9 (02:25): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17, CSS Background - http://www.w3schools.com/css/css_background.asp
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:25): you bastard bot
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:26): well I understand on how to set it as a css background
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:26): but in this case I have the bg image is being resized by a js script
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:26): based upon the browser's width and height
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:26): so I need it in the markup like this
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:26): then the js isn't working quite right
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:27): if I use the xhmlt doctype it's just fine
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:27): it's just the html5 doctype
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:27): that throws it off
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:27): if you check the 'homgepage' you can see it
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:28): i see white space at the bottom when the image ends on the homepage too
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:29): I guess you can see it on ie only
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:29): not ff or chrome
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (02:29): 375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae: changing the doctype from xhtml to html5 won‚Äôt cause any rendering change
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:29): something working in IE only is something broken
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:30): i'm trying to be cross browser scripting
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:30): fml
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (02:30): 375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae: <img>s are inline bra
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (02:30): you gotta make it a block-level element
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (02:31): the ‚Äúwhite space‚Äù you are seeing is the descender space for the line on which the image is sitting
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:32): well i'm very new to this whole web stuff, could you help explain it in better terms, as like how I can fix it?
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:32): you say I need to make it block not inline?
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:32): display: block?
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:33): wow it looks like that did the trick
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (02:33): lol
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:35): not in FF4 still
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (02:35): 375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae: please stop using inline styles.
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:35): please stop testing in IE first
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (02:41): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: bring me a pizza cool?
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (03:01): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 I never test ie
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (03:01): well if I do it's last
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (03:01): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 i'm just learning :p
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (03:01): f -inline
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (03:01): and 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 I didn't update the website just local testing
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (03:02): now it's updated ;p
375dadb1aa259a15112b70bdb3a0d6ae (03:02): and yeah it looks great now thanks c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3
